item.title: Duterte vows stronger cooperation with UN vs. COVID-19, terror
item.description: President Rodrigo Duterte on Wednesday called for “more openness, deeper solidarity, and stronger cooperation among nations” to combat the threat of the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and terrorism.

item.title: Animal rights group to file charges over mass shooting of dogs
item.description: dogsAn animal rights advocacy group is planning to press charges against those responsible for the mass shooting of dogs in Buenavista, Marinduque in August.

item.title: Big-time scammer gets nabbed after 8 years
item.description: A scammer who stole tens of millions of pesos from several individuals and groups was arrested based on estafa charges after eight years.

item.title: PWD, huli matapos ireklamo sa umano'y 'car-pasalo' modus
item.description: Isang person with disability (PWD) ang nahuli ng mga awtoridad matapos ireklamo ng "car-pasalo" modus kung saan mga talbog umanong tseke ang ibinibigay ng suspek sa kaniyang mga biktimang nagbebenta ng marerematang sasakyan.

item.title: Man dies as 911 hotline falls short
item.description: A 55-year-old taxi driver died after not receiving any response from the 911 hotline for emergency calls.

item.title: US places sanctions on ICC prosecutor Bensouda as she probes US soldiers for war crimes
item.description: US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo announced sanctions Wednesday on the prosecutor of the International Criminal Court, Fatou Bensouda, objecting to the investigation of US soldiers for alleged war crimes in Afghanistan.

item.title: 41 more PNP personnel test positive for COVID-19
item.description: The Philippine National Police (PNP) on Wednesday reported 41 new coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) infections, bringing the total tally to 4,220.

item.title: Hitting women hard, pandemic makes gender poverty gap wider - UN
item.description: The coronavirus pandemic will widen the poverty gap between women and men, pushing 47 million more women and girls into impoverished lives by next year, and undoing progress made in recent decades, the United Nations said on Wednesday.

item.title: Bakit nagdudulot ng pimple ang face mask at paano ito maiiwasan?
item.description: Dahil kinakailangang magsuot ng face mask ngayong may COVID-19 pandemic, ilan sa mga tao ang nagkakaroon ng "maskne" o acne na dulot ng face mask. Bakit nga ba nagkakaroon nito at ano ang maaaring gawin para ito maiiwasan?

item.title: Makati City launches country's first pooled testing
item.description: Makati City is the first city in the country to employ pooled testing for the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and about 6,000 residents, including market vendors and public utility vehicle drivers were tapped to participate, Raffy Tima reported Wednesday on "24 Oras."

item.title: Tatlong dambuhalang oarfish nakita sa magkakaibang lugar sa Mindanao
item.description: Tatlong mahahabang oarfish ang nakita ng mga mangingisda at mga residente sa magkakahiwalay na lugar sa Agusan at Norte at Misamis Oriental.

item.title: White sand at Manila Bay? DENR already working on it
item.description: “Gagawin white sand itong, dito sa may bay walk area para makita ng tao na kapag puti ang kulay ng isang bagay, kailangan pangalagaan mo ito at wag mo dumihan,” DENR undersecretary Benny Antiporda said.

item.title: Germany says Putin critic Navalny was poisoned with Novichok
item.description: A critic of Russian President Vladmir Putin now in a coma and being treated in a Berlin hospital was poisoned with a nerve agent of the Novichok family, a German government spokesman said on Wednesday.

item.title: Order to release Pemberton proof of skewed justice system --rights group
item.description: The order for the early release of American soldier Joseph Scott Pemberton, who killed transgender Filipina Jennifer Laude in 2014, proves that the Philippine justice system is “skewed” toward “the rich, the powerful, and the favored,” a rights group said Wednesday.

item.title: BuCor will carry out court order to release Pemberton --AFP
item.description: It is the Bureau of Corrections that will be complying with a court's order to allow the early release of Joseph Scott Pemberton, Armed Forcesspokesperson Major General Edgard Arevalo said Wednesday.
